intro: Phacelia platycarpa var. madrensis, commonly known as Madreño phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, hairy leaves that are typically gray-green in color. The plant produces clusters of blue to purple flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in desert or semi-desert environments. This variety is noted for its ornamental value and its role in supporting local pollinators.
